document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is mostly similar to
L . umbratula
in having the wing fuscous along R1 only ( Fig. 2 A, F), and the shape of aedeagus ( Figs. 10 E, 14D), but can be distinguished from the latter by the color patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 7 A) and female ( Fig. 7 B), and the paramere narrowed apically ( Fig. 10 D); see below that species.

However, the specimens show difference from the latest and most relevant description of
L . argentina
from Thailand ( Okada 1987 ) in having the wing fuscous along R1 only ( Fig. 2 A), while no conspicuous difference could be found in the color patterns of abdominal tergites in male ( Fig. 7 A; Fig. 2 G, H in Okada 1987 ), and the shape of paramere and aedeagus ( Fig. 10 D, E; Fig. 2 F in Okada 1987 ). Therefore, all of the specimens were identified as
L . argentina
to avoid further confusion.

FIGURE 10.
Leucophenga argentina de Meijere, 1924
, male head and terminalia in lateral view. A. Head and postocellar setae (poc s); B. Epandrium (epand), surstylus (sur) and cercus (cerc); C. Hypandrium (hypd), paramere (pm), gonopods (gon) and aedeagus (aed); D. Paramere; E. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Ocellar triangle dark brown, with ca. 0–2 seta(e) above ocellar setae. Frons brownish yellow. Pedicel brownish yellow; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus brownish yellow. Palpus brownish yellow.

Mesonotum brownish yellow, with four interrupted, brown, longitudinal stripes submedially and laterally in male ( Fig. 3 A), brownish yellow, brownish before scutellum in female. Postpronotal lobe yellow ( Fig. 3 B). Acrostichal setulae in ca. 8–10 irregular rows ( Fig. 3 A). Scutellum brownish, dark brown laterally, brownish yellow at tip ( Fig. 3 A). Pleura, katepisternum and meron mostly brown above ( Fig. 3 B). Wing ( Fig. 2 A): Costal vein between R2+3 and R4+5 distally with ca. 4–6 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Abdominal tergites black, with a pair of yellow patches submedially between 2nd to 4th tergites in male ( Fig. 7 A), with a pair of yellow patches submedially between 2nd to 3rd tergites, 4th tergite with a pair of yellow patches subanteromedially in female ( Fig. 7 B). Male terminalia: Epandrium with ca. 4 setae near posterior margin per side ( Fig. 10 B). Surstylus rounded apically ( Fig. 10 B). Hypandrium with 1 sensillum ( Fig. 10 C). Paramere with a remarkable wrinkle subdorsally and ca. 5 sensilla aligned above distally ( Fig. 10 D).

Specimens examined.
CHINA : 1♂ ( SCAU , No. 128985), Haoping , Ziyang , Shaanxi , 32°36'N , 108°37'E ,
